intro: Montanoa moritziana, commonly known as the Moritz's montanoa, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
